title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A witty social commentary on love, class, and manners in 19th-century England.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling vision of a totalitarian state where thought and individuality are suppressed.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A coming-of-age story exploring themes of racial injustice and morality in the American South.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: An allegorical fable about a shepherd boy's journey to fulfill his Personal Legend.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopian future, teenagers fight to the death in a televised event.

title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
author: Eric Carle
description: A beloved board book following a caterpillar's journey of eating and transformation.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A twisty tale of a missing wife and a husband under suspicion.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A symbologist races to solve a murder and uncover a centuries-old conspiracy.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut stranded on Mars must use his ingenuity to survive.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A scientist creates a monstrous creature, exploring the consequences of unchecked ambition.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A disillusioned teenager narrates his alienation and angst in post-WWII America.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A family's isolation at a haunted hotel descends into madness.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A young boy discovers he's a wizard and begins his magical education.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A sweeping exploration of human history from the Stone Age to the present.

title: Little Women
author: Louisa May Alcott
description: The lives and loves of the March sisters during the American Civil War.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A home-loving hobbit embarks on an unexpected adventure with dwarves.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: A young girl finds solace in stealing books during Nazi Germany.

title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie
description: Guests on an isolated island are murdered one by one.

title: The Secret Garden
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
description: A spoiled girl discovers a hidden garden and the power of friendship.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: A fable about farm animals who revolt against their human farmer, exploring themes of power and corruption.

title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: A collection of short stories featuring the iconic detective Sherlock Holmes and his partner, Dr. Watson.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A vision of a future society where individuality and freedom are suppressed in favor of control and conformity.

title: The Outsiders
author: S.E. Hinton
description: A story about the rivalry between two teen gangs in 1960s Oklahoma.

title: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
description: A powerful story of resilience and redemption through the letters of African American women in the rural South.

title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
description: The first book in the Kingkiller Chronicle, chronicling the adventures of a legendary musician and magician.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A disgraced journalist and a young female hacker investigate the disappearance of a wealthy man's niece.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A hilarious journey through space after Earth is demolished.

title: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time
author: Mark Haddon
description: A mathematically gifted autistic boy investigates the death of a neighbor's dog.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
author: C.S. Lewis
description: Four siblings discover a magical world through a wardrobe.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A chilling future where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any they find.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A woman forced into reproductive servitude in a totalitarian theocracy.

title: Flowers for Algernon
author: Daniel Keyes
description: A man with low IQ undergoes an experimental surgery to increase his intelligence.

title: The Help
author: Kathryn Stockett
description: The lives of African American maids in 1960s Mississippi.

title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
author: Stephen Chbosky
description: An introverted teen navigates friendship, love, and mental health in the 1990s.

title: A Wrinkle in Time
author: Madeleine L'Engle
description: Children journey through space and time to rescue their missing father.

title: The Hate U Give
author: Angie Thomas
description: A teen witnesses a police shooting of her unarmed friend and becomes an activist.

title: Born a Crime
author: Trevor Noah
description: Trevor Noah's humorous and insightful memoir of growing up mixed-race in apartheid South Africa.

title: The House on Mango Street
author: Sandra Cisneros
description: A series of vignettes exploring the life of a young Latina girl in Chicago.

title: The Princess Bride
author: William Goldman
description: A  fairytale adventure filled with swashbuckling, romance, and giants.

title: A Short History of Nearly Everything
author: Bill Bryson
description: An entertaining journey through the world of science, from the Big Bang to the rise of civilization.

title: Cosmos
author: Carl Sagan
description: A classic exploration of the universe and our place within it.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: Sweeping exploration of humankind, from our evolutionary past to potential futures.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: Dives into the two systems of our minds, explaining how intuition and logic shape our decisions.

title: The Emperor of All Maladies: A Biography of Cancer
author: Siddhartha Mukherjee
description: Pulitzer-Prize winning exploration of the history of cancer, scientific advancements, and the human toll.

title: The Sixth Extinction: An Unnatural History
author: Elizabeth Kolbert
description: Investigates past mass extinctions and the current, human-driven biodiversity crisis.

title: Guns, Germs, and Steel
author: Jared Diamond
description: Analyzes how geography and environment shaped the unequal development of human societies.

title: The Selfish Gene
author: Richard Dawkins
description: Introduces the idea of genes as the driving force of evolution.

title: Quiet: The Power of Introverts in a World That Can't Stop Talking
author: Susan Cain
description: Challenges the bias towards extroversion, exploring the strengths and values of introverts.

title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
author: Rebecca Skloot
description: The story of a woman whose cells were taken without consent, leading to groundbreaking medical discoveries.
